snippet: The garbage has contaminated the soil and water and attracted infectious pests, the organization, Mercy Corps, said.
abstract: American-based charity Mercy Corps reports that uncollected trash in towns across Yemen, contaminating soil and water, is fueling spread of dengue fever and malaria; municipal services in country have been disrupted since beginning of clashes between government and Houthi rebels.
lead_paragraph: The garbage has contaminated the soil and water and attracted infectious pests, the organization, Mercy Corps, said.

headline.main: Yemen: Dengue Fever and Malaria Are Linked to Trash
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Yemen: Dengue Fever and Malaria Are Linked to Trash
